subject: Re: [junit] Testing classes that rely on a datasource?
msgSnippet: ... What about Jakarta Cactus? [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
On Fri, Mar 28, 2003 at 11:31:42PM -0000, Dave wrote:

> I have the need to test a factory that normally exists inside an EJB
> container. This factory relies on the container datasource being
> present to retrieve data. Unfortunately, datasource is non-remotable
> so unless you access the factory via an EJB, the datasource doesn't
> really exist and this you get an error.
>
> Does anyone have an idea on how to test this? I've tried to use
> mockobjects but the factory has static methods (can't override).

What about Jakarta Cactus?





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
